section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: BMW Group Roadside Assistance can be contacted if assistance is needed in the event of a breakdown.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: In the event of a breakdown, data on the vehicle's condition is transmitted to the BMW Roadside Assistance. In some circumstances, the malfunctions can be eliminated directly.
There are various ways of contacting BMW Roadside Assistance.

item.paragraph: Via a Check Control message.
Supplementary text messages.
Via a call with a mobile phone.
Via the BMW app.

section.paragraph: The BMW Roadside Assistance provides around-the-clock breakdown assistance throughout the entire year to ensure worry free driving in all of Japan.

Without exception, this service applies to any owner of a BMW and covers numerous measures in the case of an emergency. Depending on the owner's situation and wishes, this also includes repairs on site, provision of towing services and possible alternative transport means or the assurance of overnight accommodations.
If necessary, depending on the national market version and the vehicle type, a different Roadside Assistance provider may be assigned via the ConnectedDrive customer portal.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired service.

section.title: Teleservice Diagnosis
section.paragraph: Teleservice Diagnostics enables detailed vehicle data to be transmitted via cellular networks, which is necessary for vehicle diagnosis. This data is transmitted automatically. It may be necessary to approve this on the control display.

section.title: Teleservice Help
section.paragraph: Depending on the country, Teleservice Help enables an in-depth diagnosis of the vehicle by BMW Roadside Assistance via wireless transmission.
You can launch Teleservice Help by requesting it through BMW Roadside Assistance.

action-step.paragraph: Park the vehicle in a safe place.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: In emergency situations, the system can be used to trigger an emergency call either automatically or manually.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: In compliance with the applicable laws, the vehicle is equipped with an automatic Assist system or an automatic SOS device with automatic activation function, which uses the National Automated Information System or the direct national emergency call number, depending on the country where it is being used. Sellers, manufacturers, and importers of the vehicle accept no responsibility for any malfunctions of the automatic Assist system or the automatic SOS device if such malfunctions are caused by deficiencies of the call operator of the National Automated Assist System, the infrastructure of the National Automated Assist System or the call operator of the telecommunications network, by improper use of the automatic Assist system or the automatic SOS device by the customer, or by other factors not under the control of the seller, manufacturer, or importer of the vehicle. In compliance with the applicable laws, neither the automatic Assist system nor the automatic SOS device can be deactivated.
Depending on the vehicle equipment and national-market version, the vehicle is equipped with an Assist system.
Only press the SOS button in an emergency.
The emergency call establishes a connection to a public emergency call number.
Among other things, this depends on the mobile phone network and national regulations.
The Emergency Call is placed via an integrated SIM card in the vehicle and cannot be switched off.
For technical reasons, the emergency call cannot be guaranteed under unfavorable conditions.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The fire extinguisher can put out vehicle fires.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the vehicle equipment and national-market version, the vehicle is equipped with a fire extinguisher.

overview.overview-text: Observe when using the fire extinguisher

warning.paragraph: Warning
Using the fire extinguisher improperly can cause injury. There is a risk of injury. Observe the information below when using the fire extinguisher:

item.paragraph: Do not inhale the extinguishing agent. If the extinguishing agent is inhaled, move the person to fresh air. If the victim experiences breathing difficulties, contact a doctor immediately.
Do not allow the extinguishing agent to come into contact with the skin. Prolonged contact with the extinguishing agent can cause the skin to dry out.

Do not allow the extinguishing agent to come into contact with the eyes. If it does come into contact with the eyes, rinse them immediately with plenty of water. In case of prolonged discomfort, contact a doctor.

warning.paragraph: Warning

Objects in the driver's footwell can limit the pedal travel or block a depressed pedal. There is a risk of accident. Stow objects in the vehicle such that they are secured and cannot enter into the driver's footwell.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: The fire extinguisher is located in the interior, e.g., under the seat or in the glove compartment.

section.title: Taking out the fire extinguisher
section.paragraph: Open the screw shackles on the retaining strap.

section.title: Using the fire extinguisher
section.paragraph: To use the fire extinguisher, follow the manufacturer's instructions displayed on it, along with the accompanying information.

action-step.paragraph: Insert the fire extinguisher into the holder.
Hook in and close the screw shackles.

section.title: Maintenance and refilling
section.paragraph: Have the fire extinguisher checked every 2 years by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Take note of the next maintenance date for the fire extinguisher.
Replace the fire extinguisher after use or have it refilled.

section.title: What to do after an accident
General information
section.paragraph: After an accident, comply with the following safety precautions with regard to the high-voltage system:

item.paragraph: Engage the selector lever position P, apply the parking brake and turn off the drive readiness and standby.
Apply the parking brake and turn off the drive readiness and standby.
Secure the crash site.
Lock the vehicle after exiting.
Immediately notify rescue forces, police, or firefighters of the fact that your vehicle is equipped with a high-voltage system.
Do not inhale any gases escaping from the high-voltage battery; if needed, maintain a safe distance from the vehicle.
Do not inhale any gases escaping from the high-voltage battery; if needed, maintain a safe distance from the vehicle.

overview.overview-text: Do not touch high voltage components after an accident

warning.paragraph: DANGER

Contact with live components can lead to an electric shock. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. After an accident, do not touch any high-voltage components such as orange colored high-voltage cables or parts that are in contact with exposed high-voltage cables.
Warning
Fluids in the high-voltage battery are corrosive. There is a risk of injury. Do not touch fluids escaping from the high-voltage battery.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Have only an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop perform the jump-start.
If the battery is discharged, the engine can be started using the battery of another vehicle and two jumper cables. Only use jumper cables with fully insulated clamp handles.
Do not jump-start vehicles with hybrid drive.

warning.paragraph: DANGER
Contact with live components can lead to an electric shock. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not touch any components that are under voltage.

overview.overview-text: Pay attention to the correct order during connection

warning.paragraph: Warning
If the jumper cables are connected in the incorrect order, spark formation may occur. There is a risk of injury. Pay attention to the correct order during connection.
NOTICE

In the case of body contact between the two vehicles, a short circuit can occur during jump-starting. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Make sure that no body contact occurs.

action-step.paragraph: Check whether the battery of the other vehicle has a voltage of 12 volts. The voltage information can be found on the battery.
Switch off the engine of the assisting vehicle.
Switch off any electrical components in both vehicles.

section.title: Connecting the cables
section.paragraph: Before you begin, switch off all unnecessary electronic systems/components, such as the radio, on the assisting and receiving vehicles.

action-step.paragraph: Open the lid of the jump-start terminal.
Attach one terminal clamp of the positive jumper cable to the positive battery terminal, or to the corresponding jump-start terminal of the vehicle providing assistance.
Connect the terminal on the positive side (red) on the jumper cables with the positive terminal clip of the battery on the assisting vehicle or the terminal clip for the jumper cables.
Attach the terminal clamp on the other end of the cable to the positive battery terminal, or to the corresponding jump-start terminal of the vehicle to be started.
Attach one terminal clamp of the negative jumper cable to the negative battery terminal, or to the corresponding engine or body ground of assisting vehicle.
Attach the second terminal clamp to the negative battery terminal, or to the corresponding engine or body ground of the vehicle to be started.

section.paragraph: Never use spray fluids to start the engine.

action-step.paragraph: Start the engine of the assisting vehicle and let it run for several minutes at an increased idle speed.
If the vehicle to be started has a diesel engine: let the engine of the assisting vehicle run for approx. 10 minutes.
Start the engine of the vehicle that is to be started in the usual way.
If the first attempt to start the engine is not successful, wait a few minutes before making another attempt in order to allow the discharged battery to recharge.
Establish the drive-ready state for the vehicle to be started as usual.

Let both engines run for several minutes.
Disconnect the jumper cables in the reverse order.

If the approved gross vehicle weight of the towing vehicle is lighter than the vehicle to be towed, the tow fitting can tear off or it will not be possible to control handling. overview.overview-text: Attaching the tow bar/tow rope correctly

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

If the tow bar or tow rope is attached incorrectly, damage to other vehicle parts can occur. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Correctly attach the tow bar or tow rope to the tow fitting.

section.title: Tow bar
section.paragraph: The tow fittings used should be on the same side on both vehicles.
If it is impossible to avoid mounting the tow bar at an inclination, note the following:

item.paragraph: Free movement is limited when cornering.
The tow bar will generate lateral forces if it is secured with an inclination.

section.title: Tow rope
section.paragraph: Observe the following notes when using the tow rope:

item.paragraph: Use nylon ropes or straps, which will enable the vehicle to be towed without jerking.
Make sure the tow rope is not twisted when fastening.
Check the attachment of the tow fitting and tow rope in regular intervals.
Do not exceed a towing speed of 50 km/h50 km/h, 30 mph30 mph/50 km/h.
Do not exceed a towing distance of 5 km5 km, 3 miles3 miles/5 km.
When driving off to tow the vehicle, make sure that the tow rope is taut.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The screw-in tow fitting should always be carried in the vehicle.
The tow fitting can be screwed in at the front or rear of the vehicle.

Observe the following notes when using the tow fitting:

item.paragraph: Use only the tow fitting provided with the vehicle.
Turn the tow fitting at least 5 turns clockwise and screw it in as far as it will go. If necessary, tighten with a suitable object.
After use, unscrew the tow fitting counter-clockwise.
Use the tow fitting for towing on paved roads only.
Avoid lateral loading of the tow fitting, for instance do not lift the vehicle by the tow fitting.
Check the attachment of the tow fitting in regular intervals.
